Reviews.Title: “Too Bad I didn't check out on TripAdvisor before going...”
Reviews.Author: Greenbmr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice hostel, with Wifi, a good atmosphere and with a nice worm welcoming staff that cares about you more than about your money, than go to a different place. I reserved two night's but had to leave Rome one day earlier. When I arrived, I asked the hotel (which for some reason is written on HostelWorld as a Hostel, which it is not in any way), to cancel my second night. As It did say on the website that the hostel policy allows you to cancel up to one day prior, I couldn't understand why they would not try to help me out. I talked to the manager, and was even more surprised when he just tried to get more money out of me... I wish I had something good to say about the place, I saw the rooms, they looked ok, but everything was dark and filled with bad vibes. The best part of my trip was leaving this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lots to be desired for something that calls itself "Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: fastTraffik
Reviews.Content: There are NO Amenities. It cannot be called a hotel. It is not a standalone place, it is part of a residential building that houses other entities. Maybe it should be renamed to a guesthouse, at most. The WiFi works only in the tiny "lobby" which is a room in a former apartment. The elevator is truly ancient and is used by the staff during the day so it's hard getting up and down the steep stairs. There is no secure luggage storage. The TV and AC remotes missing - so I could not sure. Bad noise insulation and loud traffic from street. There were ants in the room (though this doesn't bother me as much). There is no character. As you can tell by the low price, there is not much activity in the area at night, it's almost a dead zone. As I paid 35 euro for a singe room en-suite and stayed there only 1 night, I could put up with it. I would not schedule a multiday vacation or a romantic trip in this place - it would be embarrassing.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Place Ever Seen...”
Reviews.Author: ashabella02
Reviews.Content: I have never been so offended by a hotel like I was with Hotel Lella. They make you pay up front because they know once you see the room you will run for the door. First of all, the hotel is a hallway, nothing more. Their version of cleaning our room was taking out the clothes of whoever was living in our room before we arrived. There was old bacon left in the mini-fridge. Our window/balcony wouldn't close and the hotel is on the first floor...perfect for robberies. We were afraid the staff was going to rob us as well. We did not feel safe and therefore told them we were not going to stay there. The staff is not helpful and kept passing us on to other staff who were supposed to be able to get us our money back. This vicious circle continued. The room was dark and I would be afraid to get under those sheets. The place looked like it was crawling with bed bugs and other undesirables. I have never not stayed in a hotel that I have booked before. If this hotel thinks they are a suitable place to stay, they are largely confused. This place is not suitable for an animal.

Reviews.Title: “Be warned- Do not stay at this hotel/hostel.”
Reviews.Author: adventura00
Reviews.Content: This is the worst place I have ever stayed- bar none. We were booked for 3 nights at another hotel, checked in there and were escorted a block and a half down the street to this crummy hotel. This should have been our first clue, but we went along. The room was musty, walls were filthy and in a state of repair, so there was just rough plaster in many areas. The bed was like sleeping on a hard slab and the room was cold. Amenities ? We had to ask for towels; there was no soap, shampoo or even a glass to pour our water into. The bathroom was totally gross. The linen was clean but the bedspread had cigartette burns and stains. The TV probably worked, but there was no remote; howerver the refrigerator didn't work and there was no lock on the safe. When we asked to be moved we were told this was their nicest room. The hotel staff was rarely at the desk, and were difficult to communicate with. There was no breakfast at this hotel- if we wanted to eat we had to get dressed and walk to the original hotel. The sign on the wall indicated this was a HOSTEL. Even for a hostel this place was a disgrace. Our bed was made one day, but other wise not serviced at all. The morning we checked out I discovered several bites on my leg and foot- I suspect these were from bedbugs. Do not stay at this hotel or hostel- Rome has so much to offer it's not worth ruining your vacation. We are in the process of requesting a full refund from the original hotel for gross misrepresentation.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to avoid !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Poojanoir
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel because of a recent renovation, as they told us. Arrived at the "hotel" we understood this was a place to avoid. The room was full of buggs and the walls were covered with moisture. The breakfast served in the room is in fact a plastic plate wich you find at your door in the morning: a cold american coffee; an instant orange juice and a plastic wrapped-up industrial croissant. We asked to change room and the pictures attached are of the best bedroom.....

Reviews.Title: “vile”
Reviews.Author: mectron
Reviews.Content: the worst place ive stayed at ...ever..it was absolutely filthy the shower was disgusting with chipped tiles and grime i had to be drunk just to stay in the room for any longer than 10 mins. and as for the breakfast it was an absolute joke yet again the hotel surroundings were as bad as the breakfast. awful soggy croissant with a vile milky like mixture that was masquerading as coffee yep i took one taste and spat it out. the only saving grace was that the people on the reception were friendly. try somewhere else they must be better places than this

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the reviews... Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: NYCnative76
Reviews.Content: I spent my last night in Rome here because my sister was in town and staying at the same hotel, and I needed an inexpensive room since i'd be leaving at 3:00 am the next day for an early flight and the last place I was staying was booked that night. The room was awful... not even worth the 40 euros I coughed up for it. The bed had to be 20 years old, with springs popping out and making sleep uncomfortable. The linens were threadbare; I could see holes in the fitted sheet. The blanket looked like it hadn't been washed since 1980. The bathroom smelled like sewage. The worst part of it all-- I got BED BUG bites the next day. Thanks God I didn't take them home with me, but that is seriously unhygienic. As far as breakfast went, my sister stayed for 3 nights and was not once served any. I heard it's nothing to write home about, but the fact that it wasn't even given was awful. There's a hotel called Crosti, where I stayed the rest of my time in Rome, that cost me 63 euros per night (booked on hotels.com). If you can afford to pay the extra 23 euros, you really, really should.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: peterlindsay
Reviews.Content: En-suite double room ok for the price. The location is excellent and the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very poor rooms”
Reviews.Author: ftylos30
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a four bed room at Lella hotel for 2 nights..Even though the hotel was in a great location, close to Termini station, unfortunately the room was not as good as it shown in the site pictures. The bathroom was very small and quite dirty (especially in the shower), the blankets were dirty and looked like those i had in the army, and we discovered a small kitchen which was found inside a closet !!! But the most frustrating thing was that one of our friends was bitten by bed bugs. Such a pitty, as we paid 15 euro per person/per night and we expected at least a clean room. The breakfast included a small croissant, a glass of red juice and a cup of coffee. In my opinion this hotel is a good option for those people who just want a sleep for one day.Nothing more. I believe that you can find much better hotels in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Never again - stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Marcin_z_Krakowa
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was close to the center and it looked nice on the photos. Aaccording to their web site the breakfast was included and they claimed that you can pay by credit card. What we got was: STAINED towels, sheets with holes, POOR breakfast (croissant with cold coffee and juice), and what was the worst, we got seriously BITTEN by BED BUGS! Payment on arrival and ONLY by CASH. I do not recommend this place! We booked it by Hostel Bookers - they ereased our review very quickly. So I think you cannot rely upon opinions on their site.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brad007
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in Lella, because the location was quite good and the price was cheaper than in other hotels in the same area. Metro stop is nearby and the railway station is not far away either. Our twin-room was very clean. Furnitures and a bathroom are brand new! The room was quite small, but very nice. A good place to spend few nights. Cleaning service worked very well and personnel was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Rome is huge, why stay here?”
Reviews.Author: WhatRocks
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I stayed in during my month-long foray through Europe, this was by far the worst. Well, to be fair, it was not *terrible*. There were no rats or bugs or anything like that. But I would not stay here again. First, we booked a triple. That to them apparently means a double bed and a small single bed - a bit awkward for three guys. To top that off though, the room was extremely cramped - it was very hard to maneuver around with suitcases and luggage strewn about. There was also only one working power outlet if I recall (and one in the bathroom), so we all had to take turns charging our gear. Second, the service. Terrible. The woman at the desk, nor any one else as far as I could tell, could speak a word of English. They also only accepted payment in cash, and in advance. One minor thing that did get on my nerves - the towels. The towels are the polar opposite of soft; they are coarse and rough. Not a huge problem, but think about it - what does it say about a hotel that won't splurge an additional few dollars to get some nice soft towels? The 'breakfast' that was included was a very small glass of juice and a wrapped sugar croissant. Internet and laundry facilities are off-site, and you only get 15 minutes free per day. Overall, absolutely not worth it. It's within walking distance to the train station, but that means it's a hike from anywhere you need to be in the rest of Rome. We extended our stay in Rome. We absolutely did not choose to stay with Hotel Lella, nor would I ever again unless their prices were reduced to reflect hostel rates ($15-17/night, max)

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well, where to begin? We stayed at Hotel Lella in one of the dorm rooms (six beds). The room itself was satisfactory although very loud because its on a busy road. However, the bathroom was disgusting, thats right, bathroom, one shower/toilet for the whole floor (six dorm rooms), which had a very small hot water tank. Only the lucky few who got the first showers had hot water. Also, for some reason they had removed the handle off the shower tap, so you couldnt adjust the temperature. You either got scalding hot (if you were first in queue), but more commonly freezing cold. The bathroom smelled awful, and was cleaned once a day (by cleaned I mean mopped and thats it), so the floor was gross after the first persons shower and for the rest of the day. The staff were very unaccommodating, and despite their claim of speaking multiple languages, they couldnt speak a word of English. You were asked to pay in advance, we stayed four nights, so once we paid we had no choice but to stay the whole time, we wanted to leave after one night. The lobby is deceiving, it looks like that of a three-star hotel. The facilities are not those of a three-star hotel. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Utterly disgraceful!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Out of all the hostels and hotels we stayed in whilst exploring Europe(which was a lot), this had to be the worst by far!! I have never come across such false advertising. We booked a private double en suite room, which, as they say, should include breakfast, but we never received breakfast once. This HOSTEL claims the staff are internationally speaking, but they could not speak a word of English. We asked about the air conditioning and they said it was broken, yet there was no vent in our room for the air conditioning in the first place. Although advertised, there was also no telephone and no safety deposit box. The fridge was moldy and there was no plug on it. If this wasn't enough, all of the sockets were hanging loose and there was an ant and earwig problem in the bathroom. Absolutely disgraceful. Don't go here, it may ruin your trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsGS
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely awful. The room we were given bore no resemblence to the photo's on the internet, it was extemely small and grubby. The furniture was tatty and the bedlinen poor quality. There were no drapes at the windows and the plaster was stained and damaged in places. The bathroom was separated by a plastic concertina door and was by far the worst I have ever seen. There was exposed pipe work and wiring, the shower control had fallen off and the towel was worse quality than the ones I use to dry my dog! Luckily we managed to "escape" to an alternative hotel the next day.

HotelInfo.Name: Lella
HotelInfo.Address: Via Palestro 9, 185 Rome, Italy
